title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a new 'DateTime' type report parameter in BIRT report designer and entering an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999,' the invalid value is accepted. Consequently, the following definition appears in the report design: <parameters<scalarparameter name='dateParam1'<property name='dataType' dateTime</property<property name='allowBlank' false</property<property name='format' Unformatted</property<property name='controlType' textbox</property<expression name='defaultValue' 55/66/9999</expression</scalarparameter</parameters. There are two issues here: (1) The model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/]), which is locale-independent, to ensure portability.
EB: The system should reject the input of an invalid date/time string like '55/66/9999' for a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the report designer. It should only accept valid date/time values that conform to a universal format or the system's default locale format. Additionally, when an invalid value is rejected, the report design should not display the incorrectly defined parameter.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps: 
1. Open the BIRT report designer. 
2. Create a new report or open an existing one. 
3. In the report parameters section, add a new parameter of type 'DateTime.' 
4. In the 'default value' field of the parameter, type in an invalid date/time string like '55/66/9999.' 
5. Observe that the invalid value is accepted and that the parameter definition appears in the report design, as described in the observed behavior.
